That's what there is be afraid of. That's what there is for a man to fear.

So, on the one hand, his ability talk like this, at length, answering her questions, is likely what caused the youth to get married in the first place, but on the other hand, it disallows imagination. Aloofness and mysteriousness are required to allay thoughts bred of (caused by) an ulterior motive. Her questions of whether the gamekeeper is single or married are directed, and answering now can have negative repercussions.

As a man, our job is to see when a girl is looking at us and wanting us. That’s all. Then just “chat her up,” which is much simpler than it seems. You talk to her with ideas and give her stuff to talk about, and she “chats,” talks, says mindless crap.

Suddenly, I understand why women stay at home, in the kitchen. It’s so they don’t wander. At home, so others don’t see her and she doesn’t get any ideations of romance with someone other than her husband, and in the kitchen, simply because cooking takes a lot of time and energy, and this allows her to stay in the house, thereby allowing the other service of not wandering.

Wow. He’s talking about it in such different terms. Fun fact: after the sex, the woman loves the man a little less. The everyday conversations are the things that make her love him. 1. Having someone to talk to. But she then “uses” the man, as this guy says. 2. Side note: no wonder Liza fell in love with me… but on the other hand, how could she then reach third base with another guy, letting him eat her out? Also, now I understand why Tamar began to like me after I broke through her shell by sending her good night texts for two weeks straight. Side note: the amount of time required to break her shell and make her begin to care about me made me resent her (and this is *me*, who didn’t actually send those texts but instead wrote a script to send them for me. Imagine a guy who does the work himself). So many thoughts to unpack here regarding all my recent relationships
